repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
1. Avoid needing an indirection to align the atomic types. They should be aligned anyway, and this causes a notable slow-down.
2. Don't use "volatile" typedef - volatile doesn't guarantee anything about atomicity and isn't needed here.
3. Use explicit memory ordering. Won't make much difference on x86/x64 but may be faster on other architectures.
4. Add a stress-test to try to make sure we haven't messed up.

Closes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5509

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
# It has been verified to crash if the atomic reference counting is replaced with non-atomic counting.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,68 @@
+# mode: run
+# tag: openmp
+
+from cython.parallel cimport prange
+cimport cython
+from random import randint, random
+
+include "../buffers/mockbuffers.pxi"
+
+# This test is designed to pick up concurrency errors in memoryview reference counting.
+# It won't be 100% reliable, but hopefully does enough memoryview reference counting in
+# parallel that we should see errors if it isn't thread-safe.
+# It has been verified to crash if the atomic reference counting is replace with non-atomic counting

commit.message:
Improve (and test) memoryview reference counting

1. Avoid needing an indirection to align the atomic types. They
   should be aligned anyway, and this causes a notable slow-down.
2. Don't use "volatile" typedef - volatile doesn't guarantee anything
   about atomicity and isn't needed here.
3. Use explicit memory ordering. Won't make much difference on x86/x64
   but may be faster on other architectures.
4. Add a stress-test to try to make sure we haven't messed up.

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Improve (and test) memoryview reference counting
